member.name: M:MOO.Data.ExecuteNonQueryAsync(System.String,MOO.Data.MNODatabase,System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes the given SQL string and retries based on certain errors

member.name: M:MOO.Data.ExecuteNonQueryAsync(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes the given SQL string and retries based on certain errors returning a data reader

member.name: M:MOO.Data.ExecuteReaderAsync(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes the given SQL string and retries based on certain errors

member.name: M:MOO.Data.FillDataTable(System.Data.Common.DbDataAdapter,System.Data.DataTable,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fills the datatable given,
member.remarks: This is used to handle any normal SQL errors and perform a retry

member.name: M:MOO.Data.ExecuteQuery(System.String,MOO.Data.MNODatabase,System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes an sql query and returns the result in a dataset
member.param: The database to execute the SQL
how many recursive times this has been called
member.remarks: This was created to handle when Oracle kills connections. The recursion parameter is used so we don't get an infinite loop. This should initially be called with zero for recursion and each time this function calls itself it will increment the recursion counter. This should be a private function as this should only be called within the class

member.name: M:MOO.Data.CheckIfShouldRetryQuery(System.Exception)
member.summary: Checks if we should retry the query based on the exception that occurs
member.remarks: Sometimes Oracle queries fail because of orphaned connections being disconnected, a simple requery will fix this

member.name: M:MOO.Data.FillDataTable(System.Data.Common.DbDataAdapter,System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Fills the dataset and handles common Oracle/SQL Server errors

member.summary: Executes the dataadapter query to return a dataset

member.summary: Writes a value to the Key/Values Database table tolive.key_values in dmart
member.param: The new value of the key
Description of the key value (only used on first use of key)
Program that is using the DB Key (only used on first use of key)
member.remarks: If the key does not exist it will be created. The description and program name are only used on insert. Update will not modify these

Description of the key value (only used on first use of key)

member.name: T:MOO.Shifts.Shift
member.summary: This class was made to handle shift schedules starting in 2012 when Minntac and Keetac had completed the changeover to 12 hour shifts. The shift numbers are assumed will be 1-based. First shift is 1, second shift is 2 and so on. In some areas, they do not have a shift 1 (they have shift 2 and 3). You must still use 1 and 2 as the shift numbers. Use ShiftName function to convert it to 2 and 3 though. If there is a change to the shift at any level look at the following procedures to change - ShiftLength - ShiftOffset - Crew - ShiftName - CrewName - CrewCount

member.name: F:MOO.Shifts.Shift.MinntacCrusher12ChangeDate
member.summary: this is the date minntac crusher switched from 8's to 12's

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.GetShiftVal(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the Shift Values for the specified time
member.param: The actual time for obtaining the shift values

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.GetShiftVal(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the Shift Values for the specified time

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.ShiftLength(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns the length of the shift in hours for the given plant, area, and date
member.param: The date of which to find the shift length
member.remarks: TheDate is a parameter in this so that if schedules change, the shiftlength can return a different value based on the date

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.ShiftOffset(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the offset minutes of the first shift of the day
member.param: The date of which to find the shift length

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.ShiftDay(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the shift date for the specified time
member.param: The date of which to find the shift length

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.ShiftHour(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Returns the current shift hour of the day (example if 6:00 am is start of first shift, then 6-7 am is hour 1)
member.param: The date of which to find the shift hour

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.ShiftNumber(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gives the Shift number for the given time
member.param: The date of which to find the shift Number

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.ShiftStartEndTime(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the start and end date of the shift, this will return a date aray with position zero holding the start time and position 1 holding the end time
member.param: The date of which to find the shift Start/End (Truncate to midnight)
The shift number of which to find the shift Start/End

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.Crew(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the current crew for the given Plant, Area, and date

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.Crew(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the current crew for the given Plant, Area, and date

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.CrewShift(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the current shift of the specified crew on the specified date

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.CrewCount(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area)
member.summary: Returns how many crews there are for a specific plant and area
member.remarks: Most areas have 4 crews. Drilling has 3 crews

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift.CrewNames(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area)
member.summary: Gives the string name of the crew (A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H etc.)

member.name: T:MOO.Shifts.Shift8
member.summary: class for working with the old 8 hour shifts. For the new 12 hour shifts starting in 2012 use the shift class

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.GetShiftVal(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the Shift Values for the specified time
member.param: The actual time for obtaining the shift values

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.GetShiftVal(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area,System.DateTime,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the Shift Values for the specified time

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.GetOffsetDate(System.DateTime,MOO.Plant)
member.summary: Gets the datetime with the plant's offset factored in

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.ShiftHour(System.DateTime,MOO.Plant)
member.summary: Gets hour number of the plant since the start of day
member.returns: The hour number since the plant's start of day

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.HalfShift(System.DateTime,MOO.Plant)
member.summary: Gets the Half Shift number of the plant since the start of day

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.ShiftNumber(System.DateTime,MOO.Plant)
member.summary: Gets the shift number for the the given datetime and plant

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.ShiftDate(System.DateTime,MOO.Plant)
member.summary: Gets the shift for a given date and time (returns the next day if it is past 9 PM for Keetac or 10:30 PM for Minntac)

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.CrewNumber(System.DateTime,MOO.Plant,MOO.Area)
member.summary: Gets the crew number for the specified parameters

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.CrewShift(System.DateTime,System.Byte,MOO.Plant,MOO.Area)
member.summary: Gets the shift number for a specific crew and date

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.CrewStartDate(System.Byte,MOO.Plant,MOO.Area)
member.summary: gets the first midnight shift of a specified crew at a specified area

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.ShiftStartEndTime(System.DateTime,System.Byte,MOO.Plant)
member.summary: Returns the start time and end time of a given shift
member.remarks: Shift 1 will return the previous day for the start time example shift 1 at Keetac for Jan 2 will return 9:00PM on Jan 1

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.HalfShiftStartEndTime(System.DateTime,System.Byte,MOO.Plant)
member.summary: Returns the start time and end time of a given half shift

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.CrewCount(MOO.Plant,MOO.Area)
member.summary: Returns how many crews there are for a specific plant and area
member.remarks: Most areas have 4 crews. Drilling has 3 crews

member.name: M:MOO.Shifts.Shift8.ShiftStartEndTime(System.DateTime,MOO.Plant)
member.summary: Get the start and the end datetime of the shift
member.param: The date time of the shift
member.returns: An array with index 0 being the start time and index 1 being the end time

member.name: T:MOO.Shifts.ShiftTypes
member.summary: 8 or 12 hour shift schedule type

member.name: F:MOO.Shifts.ShiftTypes.Shift_8_Hour
member.summary: Refers to the old 8 hour shift schedule used circa 2010 or before

member.name: F:MOO.Shifts.ShiftTypes.Shift_12_Hour
member.summary: Refers to 12 hour shift schedule

member.summary: The area at the plant

member.summary: Start Time of the shift

member.summary: EndTime of the shift

member.name: P:MOO.Shifts.ShiftVal.ShiftNumber
member.summary: Shift number

member.name: P:MOO.Shifts.ShiftVal.ShiftDate
member.summary: The Shift date for the shift

member.name: P:MOO.Shifts.ShiftVal.ShiftLength
member.summary: Length of the shift in hours

member.name: P:MOO.Shifts.ShiftVal.ShiftOffset
member.summary: Offset in minutes for the shift 1 from Midnight

member.name: P:MOO.Shifts.ShiftVal.Crew
member.summary: Crew for the specified shift

member.name: P:MOO.Shifts.ShiftVal.CrewName
member.summary: Name of the crew

member.name: P:MOO.Shifts.ShiftVal.ShiftType
member.summary: Whether this is the 8 or 12 hour shift type
